basics.name: Ivan Ocampo
basics.label: Technical Leader
basics.summary: Strategic IT leader and technical architect focused on data science, driving innovation, aligning technology with business goals, and delivering scalable solutions.

work.name: Accent Group
work.position: Senior Strategic Architect - Cloud and Infrastructure
work.summary: Leads cloud and infrastructure architecture, designing scalable, secure, and high-performance solutions to drive business growth.
highlights: Architected a multi-cloud strategy, improving resilience and reducing costs by 20%.
Led a cross-functional team to migrate 300+ servers to a new infrastructure platform.
Implemented security enhancements to meet industry compliance standards.

work.name: Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre
work.summary: Developed strategic IT solutions to support critical healthcare infrastructure, focusing on data security and system efficiency.
highlights: Optimized network architecture to ensure seamless integration of new health data systems.
Collaborated with clinicians and stakeholders to implement secure, scalable infrastructure solutions.
Enhanced data privacy protocols in compliance with healthcare regulations.

work.name: Australian Clinical Labs
work.position: ICT, Infrastructure and Client Services Manager
work.summary: Managed ICT services and infrastructure, leading initiatives for enhanced service delivery and client support.
highlights: Spearheaded an infrastructure upgrade project, reducing downtime by 30% and improving client satisfaction.
Enhanced disaster recovery planning to minimize data loss risk and operational impact.
Led a team of 10+ IT professionals to streamline client service operations.

work.name: Australian National University
work.summary: Oversaw ICT operations and initiatives to support the university's research and administrative activities.
highlights: Implemented a virtualized server environment, cutting operational costs by 25%.
Developed a comprehensive IT policy framework, ensuring data security and compliance.
Facilitated cross-departmental collaboration on technology integration projects.

volunteer.organization: University of Melbourne - Melbourne School of Design
volunteer.position: Design Studio Organizer / Masters Studio Critique
volunteer.summary: Organized and led design critique sessions for Masters students, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment for design thinking and architectural theory.
highlights: Guided Masters students in refining design concepts through structured critique and feedback.
Contributed to the development of studio curricula focused on sustainable and user-centric design.

volunteer.position: Board Member - Research and Higher Degrees
volunteer.summary: Board member responsible for shaping research initiatives and supporting the academic progress of higher degree students.
highlights: Advised on research strategy to align with industry demands and emerging trends.
Collaborated with faculty to enhance academic support for postgraduate students.

courses: Research in liminal spaces and its impact on work environments and productivity.

PwC Project: Digital Transformation Strategy for Australia's Education Sector - Developed a strategic framework to enhance digital adoption in educational institutions, focusing on data-driven insights.
Microsoft Collaboration: Hybrid Leadership Models - Explored leadership strategies to bridge in-office and remote work environments, with an emphasis on sustaining team cohesion and performance.
Department of Education: Digital Tools for Enhanced Student Engagement - Evaluated and proposed digital tools for active learning, tailored to student needs and accessibility.
